questions.description: Lenticels are involved in:
Interfascicular cambium develops from the cells of:
Age of tree can be estimated by:
You are given a fairly old piece of dicot stem and a dicot root. Which of the following anatomical structures will you use to distinguish between the two?
Tracheids differ from other tracheary elements in:
Vascular bundles in monocotyledons are considered closed because:

options.description: Xylem is surrounded all around by phloem
A bundle sheath surrounds each bundle
There are no vessels with perforations

questions.description: A major characteristic of the monocot root is the presence of:

options.description: Cambium sandwiched between phloem and xylem along the radius

questions.description: In a ring girdled plant:

options.description: Neither root nor shoot will die
The shoot and root die together

questions.description: Specialised epidermal cells surrounding the guard cells are called:
Which of the following is made up of dead cells?
Identify the wrong statement in context of heartwood?

options.description: It conducts water and minerals efficiently
It comprises dead elements with highly lignified walls
Organic compounds are deposited in it

questions.description: The vascular cambium normally gives rise to:
Stomata in grass leaf are:
Casparian strips occur in:
Plants having little or no secondary growth are:
Secondary xylem and phloem in dicot stem are produced by:
Phloem in gymnosperms lacks:

options.description: Both sieve tubes and companion cells

questions.description: Grass leaves curl inwards during very dry weather. Select the most appropriate reason from the following:

options.description: Shrinkage of air spaces in spongy mesophyll

questions.description: Identify the incorrect statement.

options.description: Sapwood is the innermost secondary xylem and is lighter in colour
Due to deposition of tannins, resins, oils etc., heart wood is dark in colour
Heart wood does not conduct water but gives mechanical support
Sapwood is involved in conduction of water and minerals from root to leaf

questions.description: Initiation of lateral root and vascular cambium during secondary growth takes places in cells of:
The phenomenon by which the undividing parenchyma cells start to divide mitotically during plant tissue culture is called as :
The type of tissue commonly found in the fruit wall of nuts is:
Interfascicular cambium is present between :

The anatomy of springwood shows some peculiar features. Identify the correct set of statements about springwood.
(a) It is also called as the earlywood 
(b) In spring season cambium produces xylem elements with narrow vessels  
(c) it is lighter in colour
(d) The springwood along with autumnwood shows alternate concentric rings forming annual  rings 
(e) It has lower density

Choose the Correct answer from the options given below:

In old trees the greater part of secondary xylem is dark brown and resistant to insect attack due to: 
(a) secretion of secondary metabolities and their deposition in the lumen of vessels. 
(b) deposition of organic compounds like tannins and resins in the central layers of stem. 
(c) deposition of suberin and aromatic substances in the outer layer of stem. 
(d) deposition of tannins, gum, resin and aromatic substances in the peripheral layers of stem. 
(e) presence of parenchyma cells, functionally active xylem elements and essential oils. 

Choose the Correct answer from the options given below

Read the following statements about the vascular bundles:
(a) In roots, xylem and phloem in a vascular bundle are arranged in an alternate manner along the different radii 
(b) Conjoint closed vascular bundles do not possess cambium 
(c) In open vascular bundles cambium is present in between xylem and phloem 
(d) The vascular bundles of dicotyledonous stem possess endarch protoxylem 
(e) In monocotyledonous root, usually there are more than six xylem bundles present. 

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
Select the correct pair

options.description: In dicot leaves, Vascular bundles are surrounded by large thick-walled cells - Conjuctive tissue
Cells of medullary rays that form part of cambial ring - Interfascicular cambium
Loose parenchyma cells rupturing the epidermis and Forming a lens-shaped opening in bark -  Spongy parenchyma
Large colorless empty cells in the epidermis of grass leaves - Subsidiary cells

questions.description:
Match List - I with List  - II
List-I
(a) Cells with active cell division capacity. 
(b) Tissue having all cells similar in Structure and function. 
(c) Tissue having different types of cells.
(d) Dead cells with highly thickened walls and narrow lumen. 

List-II 
(i) Vascular tissues
(ii) Meristematic tissue
(iii) Sclereids
iv) Simple tissue 

Select the correct answer from the options given below:

Match List I with List I 
List I 
(a) Lenticels 
(b) Cork cambium 
(c) Secondary cortex 
(d) Cork 

List II 
(i) Phellogen 
(ii) Suberin deposition
(iii) Exchange of gases 
(iv) Phelloderm 

Choose the correct answer from the options given below

The transverse section of a plant shows following anatomical features: 
(a) Large number of scattered vascular bundles Surrounded by bundle sheath. 
(b) Large conspicuous parenchymatous ground tissue.
(c) Vascular bundles conjoint and closed. 
(d) Phloem parenchyma absent. 

Identify the category of plant and its part.

Read the different components from (A) to (D) in the list given below and tell the components with reference to their arrangement from outer side to inner side in a woody dicot stem 
(A) Secondary cortex 
(B) Wood 
(C) Secondary phloem 
(D) Phellem
The correct order is :

Given below are two statements :
Statement I: Endarch and exrach are the terms often used for describing the position of secondary xylem in the plant body.
Statement II : Exarch condition is the most common feature of the root system.
In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

options.description: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is true
Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Statement I is correct but Statement II is false.

questions.description:
Given below are two statements: One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelledas Reason R:
Assertion A: Late wood has fewer xylary elelments with narrow vessels.
Reason R: Cambium is less active in winters. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:

options.description: A is false but R is true
Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation
A is true but R is false

questions.description:
Identify the correct statements:
A. Lenticels are the lens-shaped openings permiting the exchange of gases.
B. Bark formed early in the season is called hard bark.
C. Bark is a technical term that refers to all tissues exterior to vascular cambium.
D. Bark refers to perderm and secondary phloem.
E. Phellogen is single-layered in thickness.
Choose the correct answer from the options given below.
